comments:
When I try to synchronize with Stream it lists the resources that have been 
added since I used add to Workspace. When I click on a file it shows that the 
resource is currently not checked out. If I choose catch up nothing happens. 
Examining the .log reveals a NullPointerException like in bug #6372 
http://dev.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=6372 I also tried using the 
repository view to navigate to the new resource and tried add to workspace from 
the highest directory not in the workspace (i.e. if blah was not in the 
workspace I added blah from com/invidi/blah)

I'm using 2.0 build 20011116 as it was the last integration build with a green 
checkmark for Windows.

Here is the .log with the 2 NPE from both tries.

According to IResource.getFileExtension JavaDocs this method can return null so 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchManager$LaunchManagerVisitor.visit
(LaunchManager.java:578) should *not* be calling .equals on the returned value 
without first chekcing for null. 

if (file.getFileExtension().equals
(ILaunchConfiguration.LAUNCH_CONFIGURATION_FILE_EXTENSION)) {

This walkback appears to be in Debug code; moving bug to Debug component. We 
still have bug 6372 around to track the catchup problem. Thanks for your debug 
work.

This has been fixed in the latest code stream (and will go into the Dec 04 
build). The code now reads:

...
if (ILaunchConfiguration.LAUNCH_CONFIGURATION_FILE_EXTENSION.equals
(file.getFileExtension())) {
...

As the constant "ILaunchConfiguration.LAUNCH_CONFIGURATION_FILE_EXTENSION" is 
never null, the test now works even if the file extension is null.

The NPE is no longer thrown but the new resources are still never chekced out 
the only thing in the .log is
Log: Tue Dec 04 11:24:18 MST 2001
4 org.eclipse.vcm.core.cvs 1 The CVS repository reported problems.
        1=============<children>=============
        4 org.eclipse.vcm.core.cvs 4 cvs server: nothing known about .vcm_meta
        1=============</children>=============

So although the NPE is 'fixed' the problem still remains.
I believe the remaining problem is covered by bug# 6372. Is that correct James?

Hmm, although the walkback (now fixed) was the same, the sync behaviour differs 
from bug 6372. I will assign this bug back to VCM to investigate.
This looks like bug 5924 which was fixed in build 20011120.

This bug is still present in 20011204. The resources in question were not added 
with ko. They were added with keyword substitution: kv. I cannot find a way to 
get the resources to checkout other than deleting the .syncinfo from 
<workspace>/.metadata/.plugins/org.eclipse.core.resources/.projects/<project>.
This does not apply to Team 2.0
